thread.title: State sting finds 19 pot shops selling to minors
thread.title_full: State sting finds 19 pot shops selling to minors | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Young
title: State sting finds 19 pot shops selling to minors
text:
In a sting using underage investigators, the Liquor Control Board found that 19 of 157 recreational pot stores in the state sold to minors.
Just two shops in King County broke the law, according a Thursday report from the board: American Mary in Seattle and Dockside Cannabis in Shoreline.
Between mid-May and the end of June, investigative aides between 18 and 20 years old went into stores and either presented their true identification or none at all . Businesses cited for selling to minors face a 10-day suspension or $2,500 fine. A second violation requires a 30-day suspension; a third strike could mean a lost license. Employees who sold pot to minors could face criminal charges.
The checks resulted in an 88 percent compliance rate. When the state has checked liquor sellers, between 85 and 92 percent have been in compliance, according to the Liquor Control Board, which changes its name to the Liquor and Cannabis Board on July 24.
